content.description: Start low, use the features on the slab to climb up, and avoid using the large crack at the top.
content.location: It is on the opposite side of [placeholder] in the narrow passage between the two boulders.

content.description: Squat start the right side of the overhung face, and climb slightly up and left through the large jugs to a solid topout.
content.protection: There are a couple bigger rocks in the landing, but one or two pads should be enough.
content.location: When looking from the wooden walkway, this is on the left of the two boulders and is the slight overhung face that is closest to the trail.

content.description: Start on the obvious two handholds in the big crack. Go far out left to the small finger crack/seam. Then go up high to the top for the send!
content.location: This is on the face of the first boulder. It is a very obvious line.

content.description: These two boulders are practically right next to each other with a host of about a half dozen routes. There is some easy stuff and some hard stuff on this boulder. The boulders are of a decent size and are made of puddingstone.
